required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stress Free Now in a Corporate Call Center
clinical_study.official_title: Stress Free Now in a Corporate Call Center

brief_summary.textblock: Psychosocial stress increases the risk for a multitude of diseases, including obesity, hypertension, and cardiovascular disease. Stress may also result in increased utilization of health care services. In the workplace, stress leads to emotional exhaustion, job dissatisfaction, lower productivity and impaired performance. Stress management programs and those based on mindfulness meditation have gained popularity in recent years. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the feasibility of an 8-week web-based mindfulness stress reduction program and its effectiveness in reducing work related stress and improving well-being in a large corporate call center.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess whether an 8-week mindfulness stress reduction online program is effective in improving mindfulness.
primary_outcome.description: Outcome measured using Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MAAS) questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess whether an 8-week mindfulness stress reduction online program is effective in reducing stress mindfulness.
primary_outcome.description: Outcome measured using the Perceived Stress Scale (PSS10) questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess whether an 8-week mindfulness stress reduction online program is effective in decreasing burnout mindfulness.
primary_outcome.description: Outcome measured using the Maslach Burnout Inventory (MBI).

primary_outcome.measure: To see whether a one-hour weekly group at work enhances amount of meditation practice.
primary_outcome.description: Outcome measured by self-reported average amount of weekly meditation practice.

primary_outcome.measure: To see whether a one-hour weekly group at work improves mindfulness.
primary_outcome.description: Outcome measured using Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MASS) questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: To see whether a one-hour weekly group at work reduces stress.
primary_outcome.description: Outcome measured using the Perceived Stress Scale (PSS10) questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: To see whether a one-hour weekly group at work decreases burnout.
primary_outcome.description: Outcome measured using Maslach Burnout Inventory (MBI) questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: To see whether a one-hour weekly group at work enhances engagement.
primary_outcome.description: Engagement assessed by measuring number of weeks participants actively accessed the intervention website.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess if the program is effective at increasing emotional well-being.
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome measured using emotional well-being subscale of the RAND Corporation's Medical Outcomes Study Short Form-36 (SF36).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess whether the program leads to an increase in work productivity.
secondary_outcome.description: Productivity assessed using the call center composite measure of productivity computed monthly for each call service associate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess if the program is effective at increasing vitality.
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome measured using vitality subscale of the RAND Corporation's Medical Outcomes Study Short Form-36 (SF36).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess if the program is effective at increasing emotional role functioning.
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome measured using emotional role functioning subscale of the RAND Corporation's Medical Outcomes Study Short Form-36 (SF36).

arm_group.description: Wait-list control, no intervention. Intervention offered after week 16 and outcomes are collected.
Subjects randomized to this group will receive access to the WSM program to complete on their own time.
Subjects randomized to this group will receive access to WSM with group support. They will meet once per week for 1 hour. Meeting will be led by one of their peers who is a non-expert facilitator.

Subjects randomized to this group will receive access to WSM and group support and clinical expert support. They will attend 4 weekly support groups led by a peer non-expert facilitator and 4 weekly support groups led by a clinical psychologist.

intervention.description: The intervention, developed by the Cleveland Clinic, is an 8-week online, interactive, educational program based on mindfulness meditation. Briefly, each week subjects are introduced to the (1) weekly audio introduction to the mindfulness theme or particular meditation technique of the week, (2) weekly audio meditation techniques for relaxation, (3) daily articles providing scientific evidence and merits of meditation, and (4) bi-weekly email reminders. The introductory talks and meditation exercises were also provided on compact discs (CD) in mp3 format.

Subjects will meet once per week for 1 hour during the 8-week duration and practice 2-minutes of deep breathing exercises, listen to 10-minutes audio recording of the weekly lesson and practice 20-30 minutes guided meditation exercise. The remainder of the time will be used to foster sharing experiences and answering specific questions related to the weekly lesson.
A clinical psychologist will replace the non-expert facilitator during 4 group support sessions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Frontline employee of large corporate call center
- Internet access
Exclusion Criteria:
- Manager or supervisor of large corporate call center

link.description: Stress Free Now (web-based stress management program)
